content: I just noticed 1.49 will be released on Dec. 31. Could that cause issues since the year is changing, or maybe unlikely?
Shouldn't be a problem, I don't think
though we'll definitely want to be early on blog and such
we need to remember that people will be on vacations during those days so in case we are blocked on anything
Ok, so seems like the potential issues are probably more people-issues and less date-issues :)

Correct if I’m wrong but I believe we can have the artefacts built well in advance of the actual release date, right?

Maybe we should communicate that people should be more cautious about what we merge in right now since that’s what will be included in the release?
Though we could pull back beta promotion to stable, tbh that's not usually too useful: we often find regressions pretty late in the cycle.

XAMPPRocky said:

Maybe we should communicate that people should be more cautious about what we merge in right now since that’s what will be included in the release?

Hmm, why? Sorry if I'm missing something :)
i mean we are always "cautious" with what we merge, but even if we do go full cautious mode, there's always a chance of regressions creeping in
Release day is 5 weeks away; @XAMPPRocky did you mean we should be careful when we get close to release day?
i think they meant with reference to the dec-31 release.
@Camelid I meant that what we merge into master right now until 1.48 is released will be what’s in the New Years release. So being cautious now could save us time in the future.
I see, that makes sense :smile:
